body:
Our Chief Data Scientist has released your favourite new golf model, which means FedEx St Jude Invitational Picks.

The model, built over several months, will help you find value in the betting markets.

While building it, we had Jon Rahm as the second best player in the world, and backed him to win **[The Memorial at 22-1](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/the-memorial-tournament-picks)**.

The value on Rahm has gone, but there are always other players whose value isn't appreciated by the market.

- - -

## **2020 FedEx St Jude Invitational Picks**

Let's get into it. 

Here are our sexy Python outputs for TPC Southwind this weekend.

![FedEx St Jude Invitational Picks bet refinery](/images/uploads/fedex-st-jude-invitational-picks.png "FedEx St Jude Invitational Picks bet refinery")

We've manually cross referenced these outputs with the **[best odds in the market](https://www.oddschecker.com/us/golf/wgc-fedex/wgc-st-jude-invitational/winner)**. That was we can find which outputs of ours are much shorter than the market. 

In the next few weeks we'll make the outputs vs the market even easier to read.

Until then, here are the players that stood out:

* Patrick Cantlay (world number three in our opnion)
* Sergio Garcia
* Gary Woodland
* Abraham Ancer
* Adam Hadwin

Now, we could back all five, but we'll skew our betting to the biggest overlays.

That is the 2017 Masters winner, Sergio Garcia. And Patrick Cantlay.

### **Patrick Cantlay**

He might have only won two PGA Tour tournaments so far, but he's so consistent. And a perenial favorite of Bet Refinery. We might have backed him 15 times last year as he sky rocketed up the PGA Rankings. Of course we didn't get a collect.

But his talent is undeniable. He's also finished 11th and 7th in the Covid relaunch from three starts.

Our model marks him a clear third choice at 16-1.

You can get 20-1 with Pointsbet, Fanduel and BetMGM.

### **Sergio Garcia**

The famous Spaniard feels like he's been around since Jack Nicklaus was winning jackets but he's fresher than you realize at 40 years old.

Our model believes he's a 44-1 chance of winning the 2020 FedEx St Jude Invitational. But you can get him at 70-1 at BetMGM and Fanduel.

- - -

## **Bet Against DJ**

You can also find value in the players that the model dislikes.

Dustin Johnson is the clear standout. 

Rated 35-1 by the market and 120-1 by our model.

He won The Travellers in June but had a horrendous showing at The Memorial and withdrew last week.



- - -
title: FedEx St Jude Invitational Picks: Our New Model
